description: From Inuktitut (Inuvialuktun) ᒪᖅᑕᖅ (maqtaq) and Inupiaq maktak (“whaleskin with attached blubber”).

entries.meaning: The skin and blubber of a whale, traditionally used as food by the Inuit.
examples: "Nathan, my baby!" Martha said. "Come get your muktuk! This my Cousin Clara, Clara Stone."
